com.milk.command
Interface Commandable

All Known Subinterfaces:
ChatChannel, ChatChannelHolder, ChatEntity, ChatIdentity, ChatLocus, ChatSystem, ChatUser
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseChannel, BaseChannelHolder, BaseEntity, BaseIdentity, BaseLocus, BaseSystem, BaseUser, CommandList, Main
public interface Commandable

A Commandable is an object that has an associated list of user commands.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Summary
 void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
          Add a listener for this object.
 Command[] getCommands()
          Get the user commands that may be used with this object.
 void removeListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
          Remove a listener from this command that was previously added with addListener.
 

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener for this object. The listener will get any events that it defines interfaces for. Commandable itself is defined to only ever send CommandableEvents, but actual implementations may send other event types. If the listener is in fact a CommandableListener, then it immediately gets sent a commandAdded event per command of the Commandable.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
CommandableEvent, CommandableListener

removeListener

public void removeListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Remove a listener from this command that was previously added with addListener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

getCommands

public Command[] getCommands()
Get the user commands that may be used with this object.

Returns:
the array of commands
